import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
from scipy.stats import pearsonr
import spacy
from collections import Counter
source.be61f28e:
fig = px.bar(price_by_province.head(10), x='province',y='price', title='Top Ten Provinces with Most Expensive Wine')
fig.show()
source.2c20e411:
cal_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'California']
was_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'Washington']
bor_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'Bordeaux']
tus_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'Tuscany']
ore_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'Oregon']
bur_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'Burgundy']
nsp_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'Northern Spain']
pie_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'Piedmont']
men_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'Mendoza Province']
ven_price = price_by_province[price_by_province['province'] == 'Veneto']
source.e1ec52e3:
fig = go.Figure()
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=cal_price['province'],y=cal_price['price'],showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=was_price['province'],y=was_price['price'],showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=bor_price['province'],y=bor_price['price'],showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=tus_price['province'],y=tus_price['price'],showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=ore_price['province'],y=ore_price['price'],showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=bur_price['province'],y=bur_price['price'],showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=nsp_price['province'],y=nsp_price['price'],showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=pie_price['province'],y=pie_price['price'],showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=men_price['province'],y=men_price['price'],showlegend=False))
fig.add_trace(go.Bar(x=ven_price['province'],y=ven_price['price'],showlegend=False))

fig.update_layout(title='Average Prices of Wines in Provinces with Most Titles')
fig.show()

source.c48b26c8:
most_common_words = Counter([item for row in wine_tasting['new_cols'] for item in row])
most_common_words_df = pd.DataFrame(most_common_words.most_common(25))
most_common_words_df.columns = ['word','count']
source.8eba1cd3:
fig = px.bar(most_common_words_df, x='count',y='word', orientation='h', height=700, title='Most common words used to describe the wines')
fig.show()
source.67e3ebb6: Filling the missing price values with the mean price
source.485ff966: As the graph shows, most of the tasters taste multiple varieties of the wine instead of sticking to a single variant
source.9146c8c3: Trying to find whether there is a relationship between points awarded and the price of the wine
source.b916b87b: P-value of 0 suggests thats there is no linear relationship between the points awarded and the price of the wine
source.788a4482: In cases of the provinces, some of the tasters such as Virinie Boone, Jim Gordon and Matt Kettman stick to California only whereas tasters like Roger Voss and Kerin O'Keefe try multiple provinces
